conclusion: Determine which container the liquid flows into after passing through the baffles.
Liquid from A flows down and is blocked by the yellow baffle, redirecting it to the left.
Liquid from A flows into the yellow container E.
Liquid from B flows down and is blocked by the green baffle, redirecting it to the right.
Liquid from B flows into the light blue container F.
Liquid from C is light blue.
Liquid from C flows straight down into the light blue container F.
Liquid from D flows down and is blocked by the blue baffle, redirecting it to the right.
Liquid from D flows into the dark blue container G.
Container E collects liquid from A.
Container F collects liquid from B and C.
Container G collects liquid from D.
